definition: this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
suffix, used to form interrogative 什麼|什么[shen2 me5], what?, indefinite 這麼|这么[zhe4 me5] thus, etc

sentences.english: Don't risk climbing such a high mountain on so snowy a day.
sentences.chinese: 不要冒险在这么样的大雪天登这样一座高山。

sentences.english: I've seen this game before… hell, it happened ALL of last year.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经看过这样的比赛，哦，上个赛季一直这么样。

sentences.english: Whatever. We should find stairs going up now.
sentences.chinese: 不管这么样，我们得找到楼梯上去啊。

sentences.english: Woofie with such long furs , I think it will be very comfy in this cooly mountain.
sentences.chinese: 这么样长毛的狗，应该在山林中感觉到十分凉爽吧。

sentences.english: It was such a different exam that only ten people passed.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没有遇见过这么样一个聪明的人。

sentences.english: I've never met such a clever person.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没有遇见过这么样一个聪明的人。
什么事使你这么样激动？

sentences.english: Yes, you are looking at one such individual.
sentences.chinese: 对，你现在看到的我就是这么样的一个人。

sentences.english: That would blow up the affair.
sentences.chinese: 要是这么样，事情会闹大的。

sentences.english: You don’t need to work so hard.
sentences.chinese: 你不需要这么样地努力工作。
